wiktionary_senses.definition: The direction of the earth's rotation, specifically 90°.
The eastern region or area; the inhabitants thereof.
In a church: the direction of the altar and chancel; the direction faced by the priest when celebrating ad orientem.
Situated or lying in or towards the east; eastward.
Of or pertaining to the east; eastern.
Designating, or situated in, the liturgical east.
A personification of the wind from the east.
The Eastern world; the regions, primarily situated in the Eastern Hemisphere, whose culture is derived from Arabia, India, Persia or China.
The Eastern Bloc; the eastern countries of Europe.
the Soviet Union and its socialist allies during the Cold War.

That part of the Christian Church whose traditions and practices originated in the former territories of the Eastern Roman Empire, including the Eastern Orthodox Church, Eastern Catholic Churches, Oriental Orthodox Church, and Church of the East.
The eastern states of the United States.
The eastern part of any region.
A civil parish of Kings County, Prince Edward Island, Canada.
